Question: Redirect process output to stdout: :I would like to execute foo.bat from within a Groovy program and have the resulting process' output redirected to stdout. Either a Java or Groovy code example would be fine.foo.bat can take several minutes to run and generates a lot of output, so I would like to see the output as soon as it is generated, rather than having to wait until the process has completed before seeing all the output at once.
Please using this api: InputStream.read.
Answer:<<<api>>>: InputStream.read
<<<code>>>: Process process = "foo.bat".execute()
process.in.eachLine { line ->
    println line
}
<<<explanation>>>: The read() method of the InputStream class reads a single byte from this input stream. This is a special case of a reduction. This is a terminal operation.
Question: How can I get the current date and time in Java?
Please using this api: LocalDateTime.now.
Answer:<<<api>>>: LocalDateTime.now
<<<code>>>: LocalDateTime now = LocalDateTime.now();
<<<explanation>>>: The now() method of the LocalDateTime class returns the current date-time using the system clock and the default time-zone. This is a special case of a reduction. This is a terminal operation.
